page.title: 12LLANBISTER SHOW AND SPORTS
page.content: Sring Bank Holiday monday sees the highlight of the year. People from far and near decend on our village. Ladies carrying containers holding sponge cakes and numerous other delicacies. Shopping bags full of wines, chutneys and jams. Neatly folded neddlework, beautifully knitted garments and crafts of all types hoping to catch the eye of the judge. The dog show is a big attraction, 102 entries in 1985, there are dogs of various breeds, pedigree and crossbreed, Landrovers towing horseboxes come with well groomed sheep and ponies, weeks of preparation can be undone by an unwilling exhibit. The side events are football, races, rounders, darts, clay pigeon shooting. Homemade teas are served by the ladies, the show and sports is concluded by a Grand Dance.
